meanings.definition: A small, round cake typically made with flour, sugar, and eggs.
meanings.sent1: I baked a delicious muffing for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She bought a blueberry muffing from the bakery.
meanings.sent3: The muffing looked so tempting that I couldn't resist taking a bite.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the freshly baked muffing filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The muffing was so moist and flavorful, it melted in my mouth.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or fail to catch a ball.
meanings.sent1: I hope I don't muffing my presentation tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally muffing the easy catch in the game.
meanings.sent3: I always seem to muffing when it comes to juggling multiple tasks.
meanings.sent4: She muffing the opportunity to showcase her talent.
meanings.sent5: The player muffing the crucial shot, costing his team the game.

meanings.definition: A warm covering for the hands, typically knitted.
meanings.sent1: She wore a cozy muffing to keep her hands warm in the cold.
meanings.sent2: The knitted muffing matched her winter coat perfectly.
meanings.sent3: His grandmother knitted him a muffing with colorful yarn.
meanings.sent4: The muffing felt soft and comforting against her skin.
meanings.sent5: The muffing had a cute pom-pom on top, adding a touch of whimsy.
